     285           0 :     while ( c!=NULL ) {
     286           0 :         if (c->interactive) {
     287           0 :             if ( c->err_env!=NULL ) {
     288           0 :                 longjmp(*c->err_env,1);
     289             :             }

     297           0 :             longjmp(*c->err_env,1);

    1760           1 : char **GetFontNames(char *filename, int do_slow) {
    1761             :     FILE *foo;
    1762           1 :     char **ret = NULL;
    1763             : 
    1764           1 :     if ( GFileIsDir(filename)) {
    1765           0 :         char *temp = malloc(strlen(filename)+strlen("/glyphs/contents.plist")+1);
    1766           0 :         strcpy(temp,filename);
    1767           0 :         strcat(temp,"/glyphs/contents.plist");
    1768           0 :         if ( GFileExists(temp))
    1769           0 :             ret = NamesReadUFO(filename);
    1770             :         else {
    1771           0 :             strcpy(temp,filename);
    1772           0 :             strcat(temp,"/font.props");
    1773           0 :             if ( GFileExists(temp))
    1774           0 :                 ret = NamesReadSFD(temp);
    1775             :                 /* The fonts.prop file will look just like an sfd file as far */
    1776             :                 /* as fontnames are concerned, we don't need a separate routine*/
    1777             :         }
    1778           0 :         free(temp);
    1779             :     } else {
    1780           1 :         foo = fopen(filename,"rb");
    1781           1 :         if ( foo!=NULL ) {
    1782             :             /* Try to guess the file type from the first few characters... */
    1783           1 :             int ch1 = getc(foo);
    1784           1 :             int ch2 = getc(foo);
    1785           1 :             int ch3 = getc(foo);
    1786           1 :             int ch4 = getc(foo);
    1787           1 :             fseek(foo, 98, SEEK_SET);
    1788           1 :             /* ch5 */ (void)getc(foo);
    1789           1 :             /* ch6 */ (void)getc(foo);
    1790           1 :             fclose(foo);
    1791           1 :             if (( ch1==0 && ch2==1 && ch3==0 && ch4==0 ) ||
    1792           0 :                     (ch1=='O' && ch2=='T' && ch3=='T' && ch4=='O') ||
    1793           0 :                     (ch1=='t' && ch2=='r' && ch3=='u' && ch4=='e') ||
    1794           0 :                     (ch1=='t' && ch2=='t' && ch3=='c' && ch4=='f') ) {
    1795           0 :                 ret = NamesReadTTF(filename);
    1796           1 :             } else if (( ch1=='%' && ch2=='!' ) ||
    1797           0 :                         ( ch1==0x80 && ch2=='\01' ) ) { /* PFB header */
    1798           0 :                 ret = NamesReadPostScript(filename);
    1799           1 :             } else if ( ch1=='%' && ch2=='P' && ch3=='D' && ch4=='F' && do_slow ) {
    1800             :                 // We are disabling scanning for P. D. F. until we can address the performance issues.
    1801           0 :                 ret = NamesReadPDF(filename);
    1802           1 :             } else if ( ch1=='<' && ch2=='?' && (ch3=='x'||ch3=='X') && (ch4=='m'||ch4=='M') ) {
    1803           0 :                 ret = NamesReadSVG(filename);
    1804           1 :             } else if ( ch1=='S' && ch2=='p' && ch3=='l' && ch4=='i' ) {
    1805           1 :                 ret = NamesReadSFD(filename);
    1806           0 :             } else if ( ch1==1 && ch2==0 && ch3==4 ) {
    1807           0 :                 ret = NamesReadCFF(filename);
    1808             :             } else /* Too hard to figure out a valid mark for a mac resource file */
    1809           0 :                 ret = NamesReadMacBinary(filename);
    1810             :         }
    1811             :     }
    1812           1 : return( ret );
    1813             : }

    1816           0 : static void bFontsInFile(Context *c) {

    4241           0 : static int FSLMatch(FeatureScriptLangList *fl,uint32 feat_tag,uint32 script,uint32 lang) {
    4242             :     struct scriptlanglist *sl;
    4243             :     int l;
    4244             : 
    4245           0 :     while ( fl!=NULL ) {
    4246           0 :         if ( fl->featuretag==feat_tag || feat_tag==CHR('*',' ',' ',' ')) {
    4247           0 :             for ( sl=fl->scripts; sl!=NULL ; sl=sl->next ) {
    4248           0 :                 if ( sl->script==script || script==CHR('*',' ',' ',' ')) {
    4249           0 :                     for ( l=0; l<sl->lang_cnt; ++l ) {
    4250           0 :                         uint32 lng = l<MAX_LANG ? sl->langs[l] : sl->morelangs[l-MAX_LANG];
    4251           0 :                         if ( lng==lang || lang==CHR('*',' ',' ',' '))
    4252           0 : return( true );
    4253             :                     }
    4254             :                 }
    4255             :             }
    4256             :         }
    4257           0 :         fl = fl->next;
    4258             :     }
    4259           0 : return( false );
    4260             : }
    4261             : 
    4262           0 : static void FVApplySubstitution(FontViewBase *fv,uint32 script, uint32 lang, uint32 feat_tag) {
    4263           0 :     SplineFont *sf = fv->sf, *sf_sl=sf;
    4264             :     SplineChar *sc, *replacement, *sc2;
    4265             :     PST *pst;
    4266           0 :     EncMap *map = fv->map;
    4267             :     int i, gid, gid2;
    4268             :     SplineChar **replacements;
    4269             :     uint8 *removes;
    4270             : 
    4271           0 :     if ( sf_sl->cidmaster!=NULL ) sf_sl = sf_sl->cidmaster;
    4272           0 :     else if ( sf_sl->mm!=NULL ) sf_sl = sf_sl->mm->normal;
    4273             : 
    4274             :     /* I used to do replaces and removes as I went along, and then Werner */
    4275             :     /*  gave me a font were "a" was replaced by "b" replaced by "a" */
    4276           0 :     replacements = calloc(sf->glyphcnt,sizeof(SplineChar *));
    4277           0 :     removes = calloc(sf->glyphcnt,sizeof(uint8));
    4278             : 
    4279           0 :     for ( i=0; i<map->enccount; ++i ) if ( fv->selected[i] &&
    4280           0 :             (gid=map->map[i])!=-1 && (sc=sf->glyphs[gid])!=NULL ) {
    4281           0 :         for ( pst = sc->possub; pst!=NULL; pst=pst->next ) {
    4282           0 :             if ( pst->type==pst_substitution &&
    4283           0 :                     FSLMatch(pst->subtable->lookup->features,feat_tag,script,lang))
    4284           0 :         break;
    4285             :         }
    4286           0 :         if ( pst!=NULL ) {
    4287           0 :             replacement = SFGetChar(sf,-1,pst->u.subs.variant);
    4288           0 :             if ( replacement!=NULL ) {
    4289           0 :                 replacements[gid] = SplineCharCopy( replacement,sf,NULL );
    4290           0 :                 removes[replacement->orig_pos] = true;
    4291             :             }
    4292             :         }
    4293             :     }
    4294             :

    4613             : 
    4614             : static ItalicInfo default_ii = {
    4615             :     -13,                /* Italic angle (in degrees) */
    4616             :     .95,                /* xheight percent */
    4617             :     /* horizontal squash, lsb, stemsize, countersize, rsb */
    4618             :     { .91, .89, .90, .91 },     /* For lower case */
    4619             :     { .91, .93, .93, .91 },     /* For upper case */
    4620             :     { .91, .93, .93, .91 },     /* For things which are neither upper nor lower case */
    4621             :     srf_flat,           /* Secondary serifs (initial, medial on "m", descender on "p", "q" */
    4622             :     true,               /* Transform bottom serifs */
    4623             :     true,               /* Transform serifs at x-height */
    4624             :     false,              /* Transform serifs on ascenders */
    4625             :     true,               /* Transform serifs on diagonal stems at baseline and x-height */
    4626             : 
    4627             :     true,               /* Change the shape of an "a" to look like a "d" without ascender */
    4628             :     false,              /* Change the shape of "f" so it descends below baseline (straight down no flag at end) */
    4629             :     true,               /* Change the shape of "f" so the bottom looks like the top */
    4630             :     true,               /* Remove serifs from the bottom of descenders */
    4631             : 
    4632             :     true,               /* Make the cyrillic "phi" glyph have a top like an "f" */
    4633             :     true,               /* Make the cyrillic "i" glyph look like a latin "u" */
    4634             :     true,               /* Make the cyrillic "pi" glyph look like a latin "n" */
    4635             :     true,               /* Make the cyrillic "te" glyph look like a latin "m" */
    4636             :     true,               /* Make the cyrillic "sha" glyph look like a latin "m" rotated 180 */
    4637             :     true,               /* Make the cyrillic "dje" glyph look like a latin smallcaps T (not implemented) */
    4638             :     true,               /* Make the cyrillic "dzhe" glyph look like a latin "u" (same glyph used for cyrillic "i") */
    4639             : 
    4640             :     ITALICINFO_REMAINDER
    4641             : };
    4642             : 
    4643           0 : static void bItalic(Context *c) {
    4644           0 :     double pct = 1.0;
    4645             :     int i;
    4646             : 
    4647           0 :     if ( c->a.argc>10 ) {
    4648           0 :         c->error = ce_wrongnumarg;
    4649           0 :         return;
    4650             :     }
    4651           0 :     for (i = 1; i < c->a.argc; ++i) {
    4652           0 :         switch (i) {
    4653             :         case 1:
    4654             :             /* Argument 1: italic angle */
    4655           0 :             if ( c->a.vals[1].type==v_real )
    4656           0 :                 default_ii.italic_angle = c->a.vals[1].u.fval;
    4657           0 :             else if ( c->a.vals[1].type==v_int )
    4658           0 :                 default_ii.italic_angle = c->a.vals[1].u.ival;
    4659             :             else
    4660           0 :                 break;
    4661           0 :             continue;
    4662             : 
    4663             :         case 2:
    4664             :             /* Argument 2: xheight percentage */
    4665           0 :             if ( c->a.vals[i].type==v_real )
    4666           0 :                 default_ii.xheight_percent = c->a.vals[i].u.fval;
    4667           0 :             else if ( c->a.vals[i].type==v_int )
    4668           0 :                 default_ii.xheight_percent = c->a.vals[i].u.ival;
    4669             :             else
    4670           0 :                 break;
    4671           0 :             continue;
    4672             : 
    4673             :         case 3:
    4674             :             /* Argument 3: flags */

    4676           0 :                 int flags = c->a.vals[i].u.ival;
    4677           0 :                 if (flags >= 0) {
    4678           0 :                     default_ii.transform_bottom_serifs = (flags & 0x0001) ? 1 : 0;
    4679           0 :                     default_ii.transform_top_xh_serifs = (flags & 0x0002) ? 1 : 0;

    4683           0 :                     default_ii.a_from_d = (flags & 0x0010) ? 1 : 0;
    4684           0 :                     default_ii.f_long_tail = (flags & 0x0020) ? 1 : 0;
    4685           0 :                     default_ii.f_rotate_top = (flags & 0x0040) ? 1 : 0;
    4686           0 :                     default_ii.pq_deserif = (flags & 0x0080) ? 1 : 0;
    4687             : 
    4688           0 :                     default_ii.cyrl_phi = (flags & 0x0100) ? 1 : 0;
    4689           0 :                     default_ii.cyrl_i = (flags & 0x0200) ? 1 : 0;
    4690           0 :                     default_ii.cyrl_pi = (flags & 0x0400) ? 1 : 0;
    4691           0 :                     default_ii.cyrl_te = (flags & 0x0800) ? 1 : 0;
    4692             : 
    4693           0 :                     default_ii.cyrl_sha = (flags & 0x1000) ? 1 : 0;
    4694           0 :                     default_ii.cyrl_dje = (flags & 0x2000) ? 1 : 0;
    4695           0 :                     default_ii.cyrl_dzhe = (flags & 0x4000) ? 1 : 0;
    4696             :                 }
    4697           0 :                 continue;
    4698             :             }
    4699           0 :             break;
    4700             : 
    4701             :         case 4:
    4702             :             /* Argument 4: serif type: 1=flat, 2=simpleslant, 3=complexslant,
    4703             :                others ignored */
    4704           0 :             if ( c->a.vals[i].type==v_int ) {
    4705           0 :                 switch (c->a.vals[i].u.ival) {
    4706           0 :                 case 1: default_ii.secondary_serif = srf_flat; break;
    4707           0 :                 case 2: default_ii.secondary_serif = srf_simpleslant; break;
    4708           0 :                 case 3: default_ii.secondary_serif = srf_complexslant; break;
    4709           0 :                 default: break;
    4710             :                 }
    4711           0 :                 continue;
    4712             :             }
    4713           0 :             break;
    4714             : 
    4715             :         case 5:
    4716             :             /* Argument 5: left side bearings change, percentage */

    5915           0 : static void bAddDHint( Context *c ) {
    5916             :     int i, any, gid;
    5917             :     BasePoint left, right, unit;
    5918             :     real args[6];
    5919             :     double len, width;
    5920           0 :     FontViewBase *fv = c->curfv;
    5921           0 :     SplineFont *sf = fv->sf;
    5922           0 :     EncMap *map = fv->map;
    5923             :     SplineChar *sc;
    5924             :     DStemInfo *d;
    5925             : 
    5926           0 :     for ( i=1; i<7; i++ ) {
    5927           0 :         if ( c->a.vals[i].type==v_int )
    5928           0 :             args[i-1] = c->a.vals[i].u.ival;
    5929           0 :         else if ( c->a.vals[1].type==v_real )
    5930           0 :             args[i-1] = c->a.vals[i].u.fval;
    5931             :         else
    5932           0 :             ScriptError( c,"Bad argument type" );
    5933             :     }
    5934           0 :     if ( args[4] == 0 && args[5] == 0 )
    5935           0 :         ScriptError( c, "Invalid unit vector for a diagonal hint" );
    5936           0 :     else if ( args[4] == 0 )
    5937           0 :         ScriptError( c, "Use AddVHint to add a vertical hint" );
    5938           0 :     else if ( args[5] == 0 )
    5939           0 :         ScriptError( c, "Use AddHHint to add a horizontal hint" );
    5940           0 :     len = sqrt( pow( args[4],2 ) + pow( args[5],2 ));
    5941           0 :     args[4] /= len; args[5] /= len;
    5942           0 :     if ( args[4] < 0 ) {
    5943           0 :         unit.x = -args[4]; unit.y = -args[5];
    5944             :     } else {
    5945           0 :         unit.x = args[4]; unit.y = args[5];
    5946             :     }
    5947           0 :     width = ( args[2] - args[0] )*unit.y - ( args[3] - args[1] )*unit.x;
    5948           0 :     if ( width < 0 ) {
    5949           0 :         left.x = args[0]; left.y = args[1];
    5950           0 :         right.x = args[2]; right.y = args[3];
    5951             :     } else {
    5952           0 :         left.x = args[2]; left.y = args[3];
    5953           0 :         right.x = args[0]; right.y = args[1];
    5954             :     }
    5955             : 
    5956           0 :     any = false;
    5957           0 :     for ( i=0; i<map->enccount; ++i ) if ( (gid=map->map[i])!=-1 && (sc=sf->glyphs[gid])!=NULL && fv->selected[i] ) {
    5958           0 :         d = chunkalloc(sizeof(DStemInfo));
    5959           0 :         d->where = NULL;
    5960           0 :         d->left = left;
    5961           0 :         d->right = right;
    5962           0 :         d->unit = unit;
    5963           0 :         SCGuessDHintInstances( sc,ly_fore,d );
    5964           0 :         if ( d->where == NULL ) {
    5965           0 :             DStemInfoFree( d );

    5992           0 :         start = c->a.vals[1].u.fval;
    5993             :     else

    7479           0 : static void FigureSplExt(SplineSet *spl,int pos,int xextrema, double minmax[2]) {
    7480             :     Spline *s, *first;
    7481             :     extended ts[3];
    7482           0 :     int oth = !xextrema, i;
    7483             :     double val;
    7484             : 
    7485           0 :     while ( spl!=NULL ) {
    7486           0 :         first = NULL;
    7487           0 :         for ( s=spl->first->next; s!=NULL && s!=first; s=s->to->next ) {
    7488           0 :             if ( first==NULL ) first = s;
    7489           0 :             if (( xextrema &&
    7490           0 :                     pos > s->from->me.y && pos > s->from->nextcp.y &&
    7491           0 :                     pos > s->to->me.y && pos > s->to->prevcp.y ) ||
    7492           0 :                 ( xextrema &&
    7493           0 :                     pos < s->from->me.y && pos < s->from->nextcp.y &&
    7494           0 :                     pos < s->to->me.y && pos < s->to->prevcp.y ) ||
    7495           0 :                 ( !xextrema &&
    7496           0 :                     pos > s->from->me.x && pos > s->from->nextcp.x &&
    7497           0 :                     pos > s->to->me.x && pos > s->to->prevcp.x ) ||
    7498           0 :                 ( !xextrema &&
    7499           0 :                     pos < s->from->me.x && pos < s->from->nextcp.x &&
    7500           0 :                     pos < s->to->me.x && pos < s->to->prevcp.x ))
    7501           0 :         continue;       /* can't intersect spline */
    7502           0 :             if ( CubicSolve(&s->splines[xextrema],pos,ts)==-1 )
    7503           0 :         continue;       /* didn't intersect */
    7504           0 :             for ( i=0; i<3 && ts[i]!=-1; ++i ) {
    7505           0 :                 val = ((s->splines[oth].a*ts[i]+s->splines[oth].b)*ts[i]+
    7506           0 :                         s->splines[oth].c)*ts[i] + s->splines[oth].d;
    7507           0 :                 if ( val<minmax[0] ) minmax[0] = val;
    7508           0 :                 if ( val>minmax[1] ) minmax[1] = val;
    7509             :             }
    7510             :         }
    7511           0 :         spl = spl->next;
    7512             :     }
    7513           0 : }
    7514             : 
    7515           0 : static void FigureExtrema(Context *c,SplineChar *sc,int pos,int xextrema) {
    7516             :     /* If xextrema is true, then pos will be a y value and we want to */
    7517             :     /*  find the minimum and maximum x values for the contours of the glyph */
    7518             :     /*  at that y value */
    7519             :     /* If xextrama is false, then pos is an x value and we want min/max y */
    7520             :     double minmax[2];
    7521             :     int layer, l, last;
    7522             :     RefChar *r;
    7523             : 
    7524           0 :     minmax[0] = 1e20; minmax[1] = -1e20;
    7525           0 :     last = ly_fore;
    7526           0 :     if ( sc->parent->multilayer )
    7527           0 :         last = sc->layer_cnt-1;
    7528           0 :     for ( layer=ly_fore; layer<=last; ++layer ) {
    7529           0 :         FigureSplExt(sc->layers[layer].splines,pos,xextrema,minmax);
    7530           0 :         for ( r = sc->layers[layer].refs; r!=NULL; r=r->next )
    7531           0 :             for ( l=0; l<r->layer_cnt; ++l )
    7532           0 :                 FigureSplExt(r->layers[l].splines,pos,xextrema,minmax);
    7533             :     }
    7534             : 
    7535           0 :     c->return_val.type = v_arrfree;
    7536           0 :     c->return_val.u.aval = malloc(sizeof(Array));
    7537           0 :     c->return_val.u.aval->argc = 2;
    7538           0 :     c->return_val.u.aval->vals = malloc(2*sizeof(Val));
    7539           0 :     c->return_val.u.aval->vals[0].type = v_int;
    7540           0 :     c->return_val.u.aval->vals[1].type = v_int;
    7541           0 :     if ( minmax[0]>1e10 ) {  /* Unset. Presumably pos is outside bounding box */
    7542           0 :         c->return_val.u.aval->vals[0].u.ival = 1;
    7543           0 :         c->return_val.u.aval->vals[1].u.ival = 0;
    7544             :     } else {
    7545           0 :         c->return_val.u.aval->vals[0].u.ival = minmax[0];
    7546           0 :         c->return_val.u.aval->vals[1].u.ival = minmax[1];
    7547             :     }
    7548           0 : }
    7549             :

    8126             : 
    8127           3 : static void bCompareGlyphs(Context *c) {
    8128             :     /* Compare selected glyphs against the contents of the clipboard    */
    8129             :     /* Three comparisons:                                               */
    8130             :     /*  1) Compare the points (base & control) of all contours              */
    8131             :     /*  2) Compare that the splines themselves don't get too far appart */
    8132             :     /*  3) Compare bitmaps                                              */
    8133             :     /*  4) Compare hints/hintmasks                                      */
    8134           3 :     real pt_err = .5, spline_err = 1, bitmaps = -1;
    8135           3 :     int bb_err=2, comp_hints=false, report_errors = true;
    8136             : 
    8137           3 :     if ( c->a.argc>7 ) {
    8138           0 :         c->error = ce_wrongnumarg;
    8139           3 :         return;
    8140             :     }
    8141           3 :     if ( c->a.argc>=2 ) {
    8142           2 :         if ( c->a.vals[1].type==v_int )
    8143           2 :             pt_err = c->a.vals[1].u.ival;
    8144           0 :         else if ( c->a.vals[1].type==v_real )
    8145           0 :             pt_err = c->a.vals[1].u.fval;
    8146             :         else
    8147           0 :             ScriptError( c, "Bad type for argument");
    8148             :     }
    8149           3 :     if ( c->a.argc>=3 ) {
    8150           2 :         if ( c->a.vals[2].type==v_int )
    8151           2 :             spline_err = c->a.vals[2].u.ival;
    8152           0 :         else if ( c->a.vals[2].type==v_real )
    8153           0 :             spline_err = c->a.vals[2].u.fval;
    8154             :         else
    8155           0 :             ScriptError( c, "Bad type for argument");
    8156             :     }
    8157           3 :     if ( c->a.argc>=4 ) {
    8158           0 :         if ( c->a.vals[3].type==v_int )
    8159           0 :             bitmaps = c->a.vals[3].u.ival;
    8160           0 :         else if ( c->a.vals[3].type==v_real )
    8161           0 :             bitmaps = c->a.vals[3].u.fval;
    8162             :         else
    8163           0 :             ScriptError( c, "Bad type for argument");
    8164             :     }
    8165           3 :     if ( c->a.argc>=5 ) {
    8166           0 :         if ( c->a.vals[4].type==v_int )
    8167           0 :             bb_err = c->a.vals[4].u.ival;
    8168             :         else
    8169           0 :             ScriptError( c, "Bad type for argument");
    8170             :     }
    8171           3 :     if ( c->a.argc>=6 ) {
    8172           0 :         if ( c->a.vals[5].type==v_int )
    8173           0 :             comp_hints = c->a.vals[5].u.ival;
    8174             :         else
    8175           0 :             ScriptError( c, "Bad type for argument");
    8176             :     }
    8177           3 :     if ( c->a.argc>=7 ) {
    8178           0 :         if ( c->a.vals[6].type==v_int )
    8179           0 :             report_errors = c->a.vals[6].u.ival;
    8180             :         else
    8181           0 :             ScriptError( c, "Bad type for argument");
    8182             :     }
    8183           3 :     c->return_val.type = v_int;
    8184           3 :     c->return_val.u.ival =

    8255           0 : static void bDebugCrashFontForge(Context *c) {
    8256             : /* This function was introduced to crash FontForge on purpose for debugging. */
    8257             : /* To test your debugger, try: fontforge -lang=ff -c "DebugCrashFontForge()" */
    8258             : #ifdef _DEBUGCRASHFONTFORGE
    8259             :     int a, b, d;
    8260             :     char buffer[2], *ptr = NULL;
    8261             : 
    8262             :     a = 0; b = d = a + 1;
    8263             :     if ( c->a.argc>2 ) {
    8264             :         c->error = ce_wrongnumarg;
    8265             :         return;
    8266             :     }
    8267             :     if ( c->a.argc==2 ) {
    8268             :         if ( c->a.vals[1].type!=v_int )
    8269             :             ScriptError( c, "Bad type for argument");
    8270             :         d = c->a.vals[1].u.ival;
    8271             :     }
    8272             :     if ( d<0 || d>6 ) d = 1;
    8273             :     fprintf(stderr,"FontForge is crashing because you asked it to using the DebugCrashFontForge command\n");
    8274             :     if ( d==1 )
    8275             :         c->return_val.u.ival = b / a;        /* crash with divide by zero */
    8276             :     else if ( d==2 )
    8277             :         b = bDebugCrashFontForgeS(0);   /* crash the call stack */
    8278             :     else if ( d==3 )
    8279             :         buffer[(d+d)] = 1;              /* crash on stack buffer overflow */
    8280             :     else if ( d==4 )
    8281             :         *ptr = 1;                       /* crash on *ptr==NULL */
    8282             :     else if ( d==5 ) {
    8283             :         ptr = (void *)1; --ptr;
    8284             :         *ptr = 1;                       /* crash on *ptr==0 address */
    8285             :     } else if ( d==6 ) {
    8286             :         ptr = malloc(10);
    8287             :         *(ptr+1000) = 1;                /* crash on malloc buffer overflow */
    8288             :         free(ptr);
    8289             :     }
    8290             :     fprintf(stderr,"DebugCrashFontForge did not crash as expected.\n");
    8291             : #else
    8292           0 :     fprintf(stderr,"DebugCrashFontForge instruction disabled.\n");
    8293           0 :     c->return_val.u.ival = 0;
    8294             : #endif
    8295           0 :     c->return_val.type = v_int;
    8296           0 : }

    9018           0 : int AddScriptingCommand(char *name,void (*func)(Context *),int needs_font ) {
    9019             : /* Add a new native scripting command (provided by 3rd_party plugin). */
    9020             :     int i;
    9021             : 
    9022           0 :     for ( i=0; builtins[i].name!=NULL; ++i )
    9023           0 :         if ( strcmp(builtins[i].name,name)==0 )
    9024           0 :             return( 0 );        /* Can't supercede a built in function */
    9025             : 
    9026           0 :     for ( i=0; i<ud_cnt; ++i )
    9027           0 :         if ( strcmp(userdefined[i].name,name)==0 ) {
    9028           0 :             userdefined[i].func = func;
    9029           0 :             userdefined[i].nofontok = needs_font ? 0:1;
    9030           0 :             return( 2 );
    9031             :         }
    9032             : 
    9033           0 :     if ( ud_cnt >= ud_max ) {
    9034             :         /* create more space for +20 more user defined commands */
    9035             :         struct builtins *temp;
    9036           0 :         temp = realloc(userdefined,(ud_max+20)*sizeof(struct builtins));
    9037           0 :         if ( temp==NULL )
    9038           0 :             return( 0 );
    9039           0 :         ud_max+=20;
    9040           0 :         userdefined = temp;
    9041             :     }
    9042             : 
    9043           0 :     if ( (userdefined[ud_cnt].name=copy(name))==NULL )
    9044           0 :         return( 0 );
    9045           0 :     userdefined[ud_cnt].func = func;
    9046           0 :     userdefined[ud_cnt].nofontok = needs_font ? 0:1;
    9047           0 :     userdefined[ud_cnt].argcnt = 0;
    9048           0 :     userdefined[ud_cnt].argtype = 0;
    9049           0 :     return( true );
    9050             : }
    9051             : 
    9052           0 : UserDefScriptFunc HasUserScriptingCommand(char *name) {
    9053             :     int i;
    9054             : 
    9055           0 :     for ( i=0; i<ud_cnt; ++i )
    9056           0 :         if ( strcmp(userdefined[i].name,name)==0 )
    9057           0 : return( userdefined[i].func );
    9058             : 
    9059           0 : return( NULL );
    9060             : }

    9062             : /* ******************************* Interpreter ****************************** */

    9934             : 
    9935     2396662 : static void term(Context *c,Val *val) {
    9936     2396662 :     enum token_type tok = ff_NextToken(c);
    9937             :     Val temp;
    9938             : 
    9939     2396662 :     if ( tok==tt_lparen ) {
    9940           0 :         expr(c,val);
    9941           0 :         tok = ff_NextToken(c);
    9942           0 :         expect(c,tt_rparen,tok);
    9943     2396662 :     } else if ( tok==tt_lbracket ) {
    9944           0 :         buildarray(c,val);
    9945     2396662 :     } else if ( tok==tt_number || tok==tt_unicode || tok==tt_real ) {
    9946      548620 :         *val = c->tok_val;
    9947     1848042 :     } else if ( tok==tt_string ) {
    9948       14852 :         val->type = v_str;
    9949       14852 :         val->u.sval = copy( c->tok_text );
    9950     1833190 :     } else if ( tok==tt_name ) {
    9951     1828864 :         handlename(c,val);
    9952        4326 :     } else if ( tok==tt_minus || tok==tt_plus || tok==tt_not || tok==tt_bitnot ) {
    9953          20 :         term(c,val);
    9954          40 :         if ( !c->donteval ) {
    9955          20 :             dereflvalif(val);
    9956          20 :             if ( val->type==v_real ) {
    9957           0 :                 if ( tok==tt_minus )
    9958           0 :                     val->u.fval = -val->u.fval;
    9959             :                 else
    9960           0 :                     ScriptError( c, "Invalid type in integer expression" );
    9961          20 :             } else if ( val->type==v_int ) {
    9962          20 :                 if ( tok==tt_minus )
    9963          20 :                     val->u.ival = -val->u.ival;
    9964           0 :                 else if ( tok==tt_not )
    9965           0 :                     val->u.ival = !val->u.ival;
    9966           0 :                 else if ( tok==tt_bitnot )
